body.p:
I was much gratified in reading the Oct. of
last month, to see your able remarks, in refference to
the late trial of the Rev. Rosenfeld this is as it should
be, I mean, that the accusers have had an equal share
of justice done them at your hands; several learned
persons were invited as visitors to attend the investi,
gation of that case. None went, because they knew, that
such question can only be examined by a qualified
and legal tribunal.

This affair induces me to crave your able assistance
in a Rabinical—and a Religious—Question, which
has been referd to me for a decision;
There was a grand Procession here in Cincinnati
among the fraternity of the Free Masons in honor
to —”—. several Hebrew in this procession which took
an active part. Among this Number, was the Rev
Mr R. & Mr I. a Hebrew the head of this Procession
the Order of Knight Templar Jerusalem marched with
their crosses emblematic of their order, when near
the church, the Order of the Templars were station,
ed in a manner, so that the entire body of the
masons, marched slowly & solemnly & passed before
them reverentialy bowing, with their hads uncoverd,
the two gentlemen named as above did the same,
the Hebrew who were present and witnessed these procee,
,dings declare that it appeard to them as wicked
Idolitary, it is also alledged that they went
through the same ceremony in the church, and attended
the Banquet in the Evening.

I must confess my entire ignorance in the
Mysteries of Masonry, but I may be allowed to know
something of the History and Origin of the K. Templ.
There is a considerable dificulties, from various causes
to find persons willingly to take cognizance in this matter

whence the question is pressed on me for a definate
answer, but for the want of assistance it is not
proper for me to give a peremptory decision.

All that I am enabled to do, in the present instance
is to point out the Law as laid down by Hebrew in the
different places and as under are the passages I have selected.

These Regulations & Rules of the Talmud and the most important
Dasuites and even as proofed of the holy Hebrew, by the comentators
are received by us Jews as standard Law, and as such it is
my opinion they should be respected!

Which reflecting on these proceeding I am led to
place these construction, namely, for a jew to pay a
reverential diferrence to the K. Templar is unnatural,
because they are in the wildes mildest of terms—
the enimy of our holy Faith. To pay homage to
a cross. Figure or Picture (empleme or not) which represents
one thing to the Eye and another to the understanding is Idolatry!

To pay respect to the crucifix is an evidence in
favour Christianity, but as we Jews do not regog recognize
a Trinity and being strictly forbiden against my king
making my likeness what ever, neither to bow nor to worship or to show
any adoration or veneration.

Our belief is in an undivided and in an omnipotent God
and to Him alone it is our duty to pay Adoration and
Humiliation—Hebrew! either in thought, word or deed!
This is the construction to which I have on reflection arrived.
Now, my dear Sir! if you feel any desire, or consider it
proper to take any notice of this subject, it is my
humble opinion that you will greatly sever the public
by answering this or call upon of this through your
useful & valuable Journal for to do so
